content.description: Stand start on the left (east) side of the boulder that faces the water. At about head high there is a slanting rail to start on and then perch out onto the face, climb good edges to the top.
content.protection: air and rocks, could TR if wanted (webbing and gear)
content.location: south side of water to the east of the larger faces of rock. the problem faces the north or towards the water.

content.description: From the opposing jugs trend up and right through cool features. You can rock left onto the face after getting through the crux but the OG line continued right/up.
content.protection: A couple pads can significantly improve the immediate fall zone, but with potential to plummet all the way down extreme caution must be taken
content.location: On the north west corner of the "Where Eagles Dare Boulder". Start standing on two opposing jugs.
